title: Gear S3 launch date revealed – it's nearly time for Samsung's new smartwatch | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Gear S3
invite](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Samsung has outed details of its Gear S3 (or will it just be the Gear 3?)
launch event, with the firm revealing its new smartwatch will be unveiled
at[IFA 2016](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ifa-2016-berlin-news-rumours-
keynote-best-highlights-dates-schedule) in Berlin, Germany.**

Posting a seemingly open invite to its
[website](https://news.samsung.com/global/invitation-samsungs-new-gear-launch-
event), Samsung has confirmed that it will be holding its next Gear event on
August 31 at Berlin’s Tempodrom, with the proceedings set to kick-off at 18:00
CET, which is 17:00 BST or 12:00 EST.

The South Korean firm, which recently released a new flagship phablet in the
[Galaxy Note 7](https://www.trustedreviews.com/samsung-galaxy-note-7-review),
says that it’s time to “talk about 3” alongside a cryptic image of a watch
face featuring a small circle on its bottom left-hand side.

That could hint at a surprise new feature, with rumours currently suggesting
that the Gear S3 will add a barometer, altimeter, and GPS-based speedometer.
Other than that, it’s expected to maintain the same basic design as the [Gear
S2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/samsung-gear-s2-review), including the
popular rotary bezel control.

What’s interesting is that Samsung is holding the Gear launch event the night
before its main IFA 2016 press conference, which is set for the morning of
September 1. Could that mean we’re going to get a ‘one more thing’ from Sammy
this autumn in Berlin?

It’s possible, but doesn’t seem likely – the dual event strategy probably
means Samsung will talk about other consumer goods like fridges and TVs at its
September conference, though the Gear S3 will no doubt get a second mention.

Samsung also notes that it’ll be live streaming the Gear launch event, so you
can follow all the action from Berlin wherever you are.
